wikipedia_page.main: Thomas John Lloyd (1882 – 27 April 1938) was a Welsh international, rugby union forward who played club rugby for Neath. He won seven international caps for Wales from 1909 to 1914; his last as part of the 'Terrible Eight', the Wales pack that played Ireland in a violent match before the First World War ended international competition.

response: * Sir Thomas Lloyd, 1st Baronet (1820–1877), Welsh politician

* Thomas Lloyd (1814–1890), British politician, member of parliament for Barnstaple
* Thomas Lloyd, Coedmore (1793–1857), landowner and Lord Lieutenant of Cardiganshire

* Thomas Lloyd (bishop) (1857–1935), Welsh Anglican suffragan bishop
* Thomas Lloyd (stenographer) (1756–1827), published the Congressional Register, known as the "Father of American Shorthand"
* Thomas Lloyd (rugby union) (1882–1938), Welsh international rugby union forward
